Class Stats

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc.team25.scouting.data.Stats

  • public class Stats
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of static methods to perform statistical computations and operations

      • multiplyVariance

                                      double standardDeviation)
        Multiplies a standard deviation by a constant, than returns its variance Equal to the variance of c * SD(metric)
        Parameters:
        constant - Constant that the standard deviation is multiplied by (e.g. for point values of a level)
        standardDeviation - Standard deviation that is multiplied
        Returns:
        The variance of the standard deviation multiplied by a constant

        Generates a pseudorandom value from the specified Normal probability distribution
        Parameters:
        mean - Center of the probability distribution
        standardDeviation - Standard deviation of the distribution
        Returns:
        A random value along a Normal probability distribution with the given parameters

      • getUpperBoundTConfidenceInverval

        public static double getUpperBoundTConfidenceInverval(double confidenceLevel,
                                                      double degreesOfFreedom,
                                                      double mean,
                                                      double standardDeviation)
        Retrieves the upper bound of a t confidence interval with the specified confidence level
        Parameters:
        confidenceLevel - Confidence level of the interval, must be between 0.0 and 1.0
        degreesOfFreedom - Degrees of freedom of the t distribution
        mean - Center value of the t distribution
        standardDeviation - Standard deviation of the t distribution
        Returns:
        Greatest upper bound of the generated t confidence interval

      • tCumulativeDistribution

        public static double tCumulativeDistribution(double degreesOfFreedom,
                                             double tScore)
        Cumulative distribution function of Student's t-distribution centered at 0.
        Parameters:
        degreesOfFreedom - The number of degrees of freedom of the model, where 0 <= degreesOfFreedom
        tScore - The upper limit of the cumulative distribution function
        Returns:
        The cumulative distribution of the model from -infinity to tScore

      • inverseTValue

        public static double inverseTValue(double percentile,
                                   double degreesOfFreedom,
                                   double mean,
                                   double standardDeviation)
        Calculates the value for a particular percentile score in a t distributions with the specified parameters
        Parameters:
        percentile - Percentile to retrieve the value for
        degreesOfFreedom - Degrees of freedom of the t distribution
        mean - Center value of the t distribution
        standardDeviation - Standard deviation of the t distribution
        Returns:
        The value for the specified percentile in the distribution

      • inverseTScore

        public static double inverseTScore(double area,
                                   double degreesOfFreedom)
        Calculates the t score at which the specified area in a t cumulative distribution function is reached in a t probability distribution with the specified degrees of freedom
        Parameters:
        area - Area or percentile for the desired t score
        degreesOfFreedom - Degrees of freedom of the t distribution
        Returns:
        The t score for the given area, computed via an inverse probability function

      • getLowerBoundTConfidenceInverval

        public static double getLowerBoundTConfidenceInverval(double confidenceLevel,
                                                      double degreesOfFreedom,
                                                      double mean,
                                                      double standardDeviation)
        Retrieves the lower bound of a t confidence interval with the specified confidence level
        Parameters:
        confidenceLevel - Confidence level of the interval, must be between 0.0 and 1.0
        degreesOfFreedom - Degrees of freedom of the t distribution
        mean - Center value of the t distribution
        standardDeviation - Standard deviation of the t distribution
        Returns:
        Lower bound of the generated t confidence interval

      • twoSampleMeanTScore

        public static double twoSampleMeanTScore(double meanOne,
                                         double standardErrorOne,
                                         double meanTwo,
                                         double standardErrorTwo)
        Calculates the t-score of a two-sample t-test of the difference of two independent random variables
        Parameters:
        meanOne - The sample mean of the first variable
        standardErrorOne - The standard error of the first variable
        meanTwo - The sample mean of the second variable
        standardErrorTwo - The standard error of the second variable
        Returns:
        The t statistic of the difference of the two sample means, based on Welch's t-test

      • sumStandardDeviation

        public static double sumStandardDeviation(double[] standardDeviations)
        Computes the standard deviation of a random variable that is the sum of several independent random variables e.g. Returns SD(X) where X = Y + Z and {SD(Y), SD(Z)} is the argument
        Parameters:
        standardDeviations - The standard deviations of the random variables that make up the larger random variable
        Returns:
        The standard deviation of the composite random variable

      • twoSampleDegreesOfFreedom

        public static double twoSampleDegreesOfFreedom(double standardErrorOne,
                                               double sampleSizeOne,
                                               double standardErrorTwo,
                                               double sampleSizeTwo)
        Calculates the degrees of freedom in the distribution of a two-sample t-test with two independent random variables, as given by the Welch-Satterthwaite equation
        Parameters:
        standardErrorOne - The standard error of the first variable
        sampleSizeOne - The sample size of the first variable
        standardErrorTwo - The standard error of the second variable
        sampleSizeTwo - The standard error of the second variable
        Returns:
        The degrees of freedom of the model as given by the Welch–Satterthwaite equation
